Contractions can be started 
mechanically. A catheter with 
a balloon at the tip is inserted 
through the cervix. The balloon 
is	filled	with	a	sterile	fluid	and	
puts gentle pressure on the 
cervix to soften and open 
it. Contractions are usually 
started by inserting a hormone 
into the vagina, and sometimes 
both are used. Induction 
of labour may take a while,
